intro: Spilanthes lobata, commonly known as the Mexican toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant produces small, capsule-like fruits. Spilanthes lobata is known for its pungent odor and has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties.
